alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 25 at 4:55PM CST until January 25 at 5:30PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southeastern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 354 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Oliver Campground to 6 miles northwest of Hillsdale, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 369 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 17. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, Oliver Campground, Hillsdale, Oliver Reservoir, Gun Barrel, Panorama Point, Carpenter, Ranchettes and Bushnell. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
